Reviews.Title: “SSg”
Reviews.Author: the_nedr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights (22.2 to 24.2) at the Aspen Apartments managed by the hotel. The location is convenient as it is near the Paddington station which has a direct train from Heathrow Airport and there are many eating outlets nearby. The staff are friendly and helpful, especially Sergio. Breakfast is standard and the apartment is comfortable, quiet, clean and spacious with a pc working table,free Wi Fi and a well-equiped kitchen. A little more lightings in the sitting area, dishwashing liquid in the kitchen and tissue paper is ideal. We enjoyed our stay at the Aspen Apartments and will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very very very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dino L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few steps from Paddington Station, so location is very good. The lobby is nice and the staff very friendly and kind! The room is very very very small, too small! Even the bed is not long enough for a person with heigh 180cm, so no very comfortable. By the way the hotel is clean, very well located, services works well and the price is very good!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 20Dream12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend. The rooms are ok, you have your own bathroom. Staff is friendly. Breakfast is a typical english breakfast in a hotel from this category. I stayed in different hotels of this price category in London and they are all the same, they all look a bit old and worn down, in my opinion it is more important to find a hotel were each rooms has its own bathroom, breakfast is not the best, but the price and the location of these hotels are great. All in one the Westpoint Hotel is a great hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “a friendly greeting everytime”
Reviews.Author: Sheelagh G
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the apartments from September to January on selected days during each week...... apartment is immaculate, well appointed and a good escape when in London every week....... The apartments are perfect for working in London during the week but the best was the friendly and helpful staff who always had a friendly greeting and lloked after me so well. Clean, quiet, comfortable and so perfect - thanks to the staff especially Sergio Home from home......

Reviews.Title: “All about the location”
Reviews.Author: sophie87
Reviews.Content: We were backpackers. Direct train from the airport which dropped us off at Paddington, a couple of blocks away. The rooms were small but expected. My husband found the bathroom a bit of a challenge but we're used to our mega supersized Canadian living we didn't feel right picking on something the management probably couldn't do much about. The only problem was the heat which became rather untolerable some nights. We opened the window briefly but we were on the ground floor and there was a huge insect crawling about right outside that we were forced to keep it closed all day and night. Other than that we didn't spend too much time in our rooms. For our purposes it was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “neither good nor bad”
Reviews.Author: carolleeDevon
Reviews.Content: 1st class for location. 2mins from Paddington station, resturants are in walking distance all you need. HOTEL is ok but the room I was in was the same standard as B&B small very tight space to get to the bathroom, I kept the window open by putting the toilet roll there as it was a sash window. Breakfast was basic, no bacon but it was ok if you are not expecting too much. Staff are good.

Reviews.Title: “good solution, great price”
Reviews.Author: hydroisme
Reviews.Content: At Westpoint you have to very good points: the location, just across Hyde Park and 30 mins walking from center's shopping streets, and the personnel. During our stay we got a very good support from the receptionists (Sergio, you're the man, thanks again!), solving some problems and helping us to plan better the holyday. The rooms are small and not recently refurbished, but this is acceptable to sleep/rest during the night. the cost is similar to other local hotels, but the quality level is definitely higher.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: T-Magee
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiancÃ© just returned from a weekend in London - staying in the Westpoint Hotel. On first impressions the hotel is a great. It is in an excellent location and even looks lovely from the outside and the lobby area is very inviting. The staff on reception were fantastic- very friendly. It is only when you get to your room do you see this hotel for what it is. The room was very old & small. The decor is extremely dated but to be fair and again with great credit to all of the staff at the hotel -it was clean. The bathroom was extremely small and was about 3ft from the bed- it offers absolutely no privacy for the occupant- with barely even enough room to dry off after a shower in the space. Our room was so small that we had to keep our suitcase on a chair in front of the door so that we could walk around the bed and access the bathroom. When we first went into the room we noticed that it was very cold & noisy- assuming that the windows were opened to perhaps air the room we attempted to close them. It was then that we noticed that the windows were closed but there was a gap of approximately 1 inch in between the top & bottom panes. We could actually put our hands outside the supposedly shut windows. Again the staff were helpful & sent up the maintance person to look at the problem - the only solution that he could offer was to fill the gaps with towels which he did for us. This seemed to solve the problem of the noise & cold, however there was a lage amount of condensation building up in the room over the weekend. Trying to make the best of a bad situation we made a decision to spend as little time as possible in the room over the weekend. I see from a lot of other reviews that for the price it is great hotel- I have to completely disagree with this. We spent Â£100 a night on the place- which was certainly not good value for money given the standard of the room. You would be far better off staying in a Premier Inn or somewhere similar as they have a basic standard at least. On our last morning we noticed that there was a brownish fluid leaking from the vent in the bathroom on to the lid of the toilet. I am sure that if we had reported this to the staff they would have fixed the problem but at that stage we just wanted put this down to a bad experience so we packed our bag and left. My boyfriend mentioned to me that during his student days inter-railing across Europe that he stayed in nicer Hostels. I had always held the opinion that I would be happy enough to stay in a place that offered a clean bed and a hot shower- if I ever decide to return to London I may need to add a few more basic requirements to my wish list before I would consider booking.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: DarekJarmola
Reviews.Content: This is my default hotel in London! It offer good rates (but not always the lowest), clean rooms (single, twin, triples, and quads), small but very clean bathroom (with always hot shower), and - best of all - excellent location. Breakfast room and service are very nice, but the quality of food is sub-par. Overall, a great place to stay for a days or even for a week when in London. Again- the major reason that I stay here is not the hotel itself, but it's location. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the Paddington Train Station (direct trains to London LHR) and 5 minutes walk from the Hyde Park for morning runs or afternoon walks. The Tube stop at the Paddington offer easy transfers to all major tourist attractions and historic sites in London. Finally, the area around the hotel offers a number of dinning options, including typical local pubs, fish-and-chips stands, and small grocery stores open late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price if staying short-term”
Reviews.Author: Dfenz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2011 for one night on a quick visit to London for a football match. We were looking for something reasonably priced with parking and access to the tube system. The hotel gives a good first impression with a nice lobby and friendly front desk staff. There is limited (fee) parking just outside the door and spaces are a bit tight but we managed okay. Once past the front desk it seems that your experience might depend on the room you get. There were 4 of us and we had a lower basement room that was probably the most cramped room you could get outside of Manhattan. The beds were extremely tight and the bathroom the smallest imaginable. That being said, as we hadn't intended spending much time in our room and those travelling with me were family it wasn't the biggest issue for me and it served its purpose. It did however mean that the room was very warm and I'd imagine that it could get very hot in mid-summer. This is no doubt a function of the age of the building but a room on a higher floor might get a bit more space. Accessing the room was also a bit awkward with a lift that seemed to take for ever to arrive. The room was clean although there wasn'y much floor space to vacuum. Breakfast was surprisingly good and very popular. This hotel is very conveniently located for the underground with Paddington Station just around the corner. The hotel was also located just outside the congestion charge zone which was another reason for its selection as we were driving to it from Wales. Indeed the area is very accessible from the M1 as its almost a straight road into the area from the motorway network. The immediate area is quite pleasant although we didn't get a chance to frequent any of the bars or restaurants All in all, a reasonable proposition if you are not fussy about space and require convenient access to the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned Hotel Excellent”
Reviews.Author: faraday99
Reviews.Content: A well positioned Hotel, Excellent location with easy access to underground and train stations. hotel was very clean and tidy. Staff were welcoming & helpful and the hotel value for money. The bathroom was clean and functional and the shower was excellent. We stayed in room 506 and was very comfortable and we wanted for nothing throughout our stay.I would have no problem recommending this hotel and will use this hotel again. Don't be put off by other reviews if you want 5***** go book 5***** The price you pay should not stop anyone from using the Westpoint Hotel. And thank you to all the staff we enjoyed are stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “great location... pity about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Val R
Reviews.Content: Great location coming in from Heathrow after a 30 hour flight-via the Heathrow connect- much cheaper than the Express- 25 minutes travel time.Walkable distance with luggage from the station to the Hotel. Rooms very small but clean.We stayed x 3 days & found breakfast to be very limited with no variety.Staff friendly but not aware that Vodaphone was @ Paddington station for SIM card parafinalia.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: rsnow5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked online--a single room--showed up at 1am and were told that a single room was for one person and if we both wanted to stay we would have to rent another room! After much arguing we were offered a room for almost double the price i had prepaid.

Reviews.Title: “OK base for 1 or 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: kissmecath
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives a very good first impression, the lobby is impressive and the location is great..... however the room lay out is quite confusing, and it took awhile tofind our room. The room was very basic, but had everything you need. The tv was old & picture green? but we only wanted a bed & shower for 1 night... so it did the trick. In the morning, that was the biggest disapointment. Breakfast..... cheap sausage, scrambled egg and beans, with cold toast. How is that a full english breakfast? I have never in any country i have visited been given such a lame breakfast! For Â£150 a night - i expected better

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: olasBH
Reviews.Content: The location it's good, near by paddigton station, two blocks from hyde park. The staff was very helpful, they speak portuguese, and give me the turistic information. The is wifi in the lobby, the breakfast was fine, but there is no fruits. There is good restaurante near the hotel. I enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Eve1717
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by the Westpoint. From the outside, it looks like a lovely, unique hotel, but inside is outdated and slightly rundown. Our room was on the lower ground floor and looked out into a "courtyard." It was a good size, but seemed like it hadn't been updated in quite awhile. It could have used a new shower curtain and a new mattress. I imagine that a fluffy duvet and pillows would be an easy way to make the room more comfortable. Pros: Breakfast was decent and there was plenty of it. Service was good and everyone seemed very polite. There were computers available for the internet as well as free wifi. (FYI: The wifi could only be accesed in the lobby.) Also, though some things did seem old, everything was very clean. Overall, this was an adequate hotel, but with so many other choices in London we probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at the Westpoint Hotel.... again”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravels2010_11
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've stayed at the Westpoint Hotel and it is by far the best hotel in the area when it comes to value for money and comfort. The breakfast was fine with a decent variety of cereals and warm food and was far more generous than other European hotels we stayed in during our holiday. We stayed in a double room on the third floor - which wasn't huge but was fine for us! Most importantly, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful and even remembered me from my last stay a year ago and seemed to make an effort with all the guests. They really made our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Westpoint Hotel Disaster”
Reviews.Author: TorontoVegasQueen
Reviews.Content: 1st night - Killed 27 bugs in the room. Was told no other rooms until next day. 1st morning - moved luggage to luggage room in order to change rooms. Love the sign, "The Hotel is not responsible for thefts etc". 2nd night - Killed 10 bugs in the 2nd room. Was told no other rooms until next day. 2nd morning - visited my favourite luggage room again with bags. 3rd night - Killed 2 bugs in the 3rd room. Other than that, couldn't swing a cat in the room (not that I normally swing cats), noisy, no bacon for breakfast, runny eggs. Safely say that'll be the last time we stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ashley D
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Unfortunately I had to stay there for four nights. I received a room in the lower ground with no fresh air whatsoever. Rooms are way too small, as well as bathrooms. There is no chance you can fit into the shower easily. I was surprised by the amount of noise from the corridors. Absolutely no peace. Matresses are of no acceptable quality and need to be changed immediately!!! Breakfast did not include enough variety. The staff has falsly smiling face all the time, but when it comes to real help... Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned! Management/owners don't give a damn!”
Reviews.Author: kiwiflyguy
Reviews.Content: I cannot comment as to the quality of the rooms in this hotel because my reservation through booking.com was made for the wrong dates. I can however confirm the other negative reviews on here regarding the customer service of this establishment- it is quite simply appalling and easily the worst of any hotel I have dealt with anywhere in the world. When I discovered that the dates for my reservation were incorrect, I immediately tried to contact the hotel, as did Booking.com. I did not want to cancel but did need to change the dates in November (over a month away).Finally somebody did email me to tell me that the fee was non- refundable. There was no effort to help me correct this mistake. Worse still, I sent two emails to the General Manager, politely asking for his assistance. No response. Nothing. He did not even have the courtesy to reply to my plea. So, the bottom line is, this hotel believes it is totally acceptable to charge people 100% of the cost of a room no matter whether or not you ever actually use that room. This is an outrageous policy that cannot be justified. I believe the owners of this hotel need to dismiss the manager responsible for this policy. I also believe that any hotel management that is this unresponsive to negative feedback is not going to give a damn if you, the customer, have a pleasant stay or not. My advice: DON'T RISK IT, STAY AWAY there are plenty of good quality, well run establishments in London that are more deserving of your hard earned dollars/pounds/euros.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: an-old-pup
Reviews.Content: The hotel is is a great location in London. A 5 minute walk & your right in Paddington Station. Ideal for mainline trains & the underground. 20 minutes & your on Oxford Street. Our room was designed for 3 people which would have been a real squeeze, but was fine for the 2 of us. Small bathroom. That said it was clean & the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was... interesting. It was a real mix. Some continental & some British but didn't really deliver either. The hot food consisted of toast, baked beans, scrambled eggs & sausages. The cold - 2 types of cereal, some dried fruit, tinned fruit salad, juice & milk, some continental meat & pre-sliced cheese. Although it didn't inspire us we were able to cobble together something that set us up for the day. There were plenty of refills & you could have as much or as little as you wanted. All of the staff were really friendly & helpful. Would we stay there again..? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Clean small budget hotel well siruated for visit London”
Reviews.Author: MILANGM
Reviews.Content: We booked triple room for 3 nights. The room was small but very clean. Towells.change every day. Breakfast good enough especially the eggs. Good situation 2 min walk to Padington station and Hyde park. Walking distance to Notinghill portobello market. Direct bus to Oxford circus and lot more seesights even at night

Reviews.Title: “Good location, acceptabel standard”
Reviews.Author: Marthinsen
Reviews.Content: Situated only a few hundred yards from Paddington station, the hotel is easy to reach, if you come from Heathrow. The rooms are small, but OK and the breakfast included in the price is more like a survival kit. Close to Hyde Park. Pleasant staff. Altogether: In London this is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “My home in London”
Reviews.Author: jada1981
Reviews.Content: I visited London several times since 2001, I have always stayed at the Westpoint hotel. The hotel's location is great, right near Paddington station and Hyde park. All sorts of shops and restaurants are nearby. Rooms can be a bit small (depends on your standards) but they were perfectly fine for my needs. I have nothing to complain about, the staff was friendly, room was clean, breakfast filled me. You can easily walk to Buckingham Palace, a very pleasant walk:)

Reviews.Title: “Still waiting for a reply from management-poor service”
Reviews.Author: Bounty025
Reviews.Content: I have asked for management to reply to my request for a refund and no one has has had the respects or professionalism to reply to my review dated 2nd august titled 'unfairly treated'. Any reason why you could not give me the courtesy for a reply , still waiting. Its such a fair request, if you have nothing to hide then why not reply. The refund value is only one night's accommodation, such poor customer service, I would not recommend anyOne stay at this hotel, management don't give a damn ?

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, warm hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Chang1967
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is very small, double bed is too small. We have to sleep up side dowm inorder to fit inside the bed. The hotel room has a very small window. The window even facing the backyard, no air ventilation. We are almost suffocate. The shower roomis too small. It is very difficult to take shower as the water cannot shower to your body. The receptionist is worst. She only care to platy the internet. The breakfast has no choice. Don't ever stay in this terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So Unfairly Treated and Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: BONTY025
Reviews.Content: UNFAIR REFUSAL OF REFUND - TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE: I accidently booked to stay at this hotel in Sept approx 8 weeks, and within 46 minutes of booking this hotel I found out from my husband that we could not get confirmed seats to London for our children to fly with us. So we are now NOT going to london and contacted the hotel to refund our money and they have REFUSED. I have provided 8 weeks of notification and I only have just made the booking. How rude and inconsiderate is this hotel. I am now not able to get flights to London for my children and I have to pay for hotel accomadation that I wont be using. I cannot believe how inconsiderate and unfair this hotel has been. Please REFUND my money, it's not an unreasonable request !! Please respond and do the right thing.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but good location”
Reviews.Author: LucioJr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I first visited London, six years ago, and also now that I've come back to visit the city. It is a small hotel in a quiet street (full of other similar hotels), and the rooms are small but very small indeed are the bathrooms, but that is not a problem for me. I just want a clean and confortable bed to rest my bones after a tiring day in London. It has improved in some points since my first visit, for example, the breakfast has got a little better (though I'm not fond of the English breakfast) and it has free wireless internet in the rooms. The best point is the location, IF you're arriving and leaving via Heathrow airport, because the hotel is just a couple of blocks from Paddington Train/Subway station, which has a direct link to the airport. The staff is also very kind, we were very well serviced by two italian guys - Bernardo and Sergio - at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: NickWiltshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two night's as we were going to see the kings of Leon in Hyde park,the hotel looks great from the outside and very nice on the inside/reception the staff are very friendly and helpful. Location was perfect for us as our train was into paddington,as you walk out of the station you basically just cross the road and walk 500yards and the hotel is on your right. Bedroom was small but very clean and OK for us, looked like it had been freshly painted the carpet,bed and furniture looked like it was from the 70's(made us have a little chuckle)the down side in the bedroom would be wall's were thin and could hear next doors TV and voices the gap at the bottom of the door was huge about 2" so when the cleaners were hovering at 8.30 in the morning it was like they were in the room. Bathroom was very small but functional the water was hot but the pressure was poor, again very clean. In summary we were happy with the hotel for the money we paid we don't spend a lot of time in the room when we stay in London but feel they need to start updating the bedrooms to match the outside and reception,we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nicely located hotel with welcoming staff and small, but comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Nat0chka
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is absolutely great, even may be called perfect if you are in London for leisure and shopping. It is only 5 minutes walk from Hyde Park, just 2 minutes walk from Paddington Station and (in case you like walking) 10-15 minutes (it depends on your speed) walk from Marble Arch and then Oxford Street. The rooms are not very large, but comfortable. The apartments are quite big and very cosy. They have enough space for a family of 4 with two teenages. Breakfast is included in their room rates. It is rather substantial. The staff are great, friendly, wellcoming and helpful. Moreover, They are multilingual. They speek Spanish, Italian, and even Russian!!!! I would not hesitate to recommend WestPoint Hotel to anyone. Our family stay here every our visit to London and when we come next time, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Luvssunallover
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, welcoming and efficient. Triple room although clean was small and cramped. Buffet style breakfast was adequate, but get there early or be prepared to queue to be seated! Perfect location as Paddington station is within 5 minutes walking distance. An ideal base if, like us, you set out immediately after breakfast and don't return until late evening.....the room was too small.....claustrophobia would set in if you had to spend any length of time in it!! Overall an enjoyable experience and we would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: GelEGuy
Reviews.Content: The biggest advantage of Westpoint is that it is an extremely brief walk from Paddington Station, yet it is on a quieter street, and thus away from the noise and bustle of the station area. There are a number of good restaurants and coffee shops in the area, as well. The biggest disadvantage, at least in our experience, was the size of the room, which was only *barely* large enough to contain two adults and a near-toddler. Any more than one night here with that many people would have been too much.

Reviews.Title: “Crap!”
Reviews.Author: itsallcrap
Reviews.Content: Crap! Can't swing a cat in the room, the bed was basically the base of a sofa bed. It was also impossible to pass two people together in the room. All the money was spent on their foyer! Do not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Haphazard rooms and layout; bad for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: ivy_professor
Reviews.Content: Our room had a tiny desk but no chair - had to sit on a sloping bed to work at the desk. Bathroom (toilet and tiny sink with no place to put things) was in one tiny room, tiny shower in a separate room that you could barely turn around in. No internet in the room. Internet only in the lobby, but no proper work chairs, and a TV was on very loud where the chairs were. Path to our room (on the main floor) was tortuous and narrow, requiring passage through multiple doorways. Extremely overpriced, even given convenience to Paddington. Bad for any business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Munster_10
Reviews.Content: The outside and reception of this Hotel gives the impression of a fabulous, luxurious hotel.....as its web site also suggests. We were warmly greeted at reception however, when we got to our room/shoebox we were greatly disappointed. The decor was that from a 1970's movie, there was NO space to even leave down our bags and the bathroom was tiny. I was surprised they even managed to squeeze a bathroom into it. We got back to reception and asked for a larger room...one that more resembled the pictures they displayed on their website. We were upgraded however the room was an exact replica only this room had bag space. We were on the ground floor right beside the laundry outlet....which woke us every morning at 7.30. The room was riduciously warm, the breakfast was disgusting (who serves lunchion roll for breakfast) and when I asked for a hairdryer i was told there was a Â£10 deposit....JOKE. There is no way I would reccommend this hotel to anyone, dont stay here folks....

Reviews.Title: “bare bones, but great location”
Reviews.Author: HeidsinSeattle
Reviews.Content: Mum, sister and I stayed 3 nights. Booked a triple room. Very cramped, so Mum got a room to herself when we got there. Hers was much nicer which made me think I should have enquired if some of the rooms for the same price had newer decoration. Overall, being an older person with a different standard I have to say she was not impressed!!The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Even though our room was looking tired -old carpet and in need of paint - the linens seemed clean and I couldn't fault the bathroom for cleanliness either. Just very small, so if you're a larger person, you would have trouble getting around in there with the door closed!! Free breakfast was OK. What made this a great stay overall was the location. I really liked the leafy neighborhood with its little newsagents, pubs and restaurants but of course that is not unusual for London! Paddington Station about a block away. Caught the Hop On Hop Off just around the corner too which was great. We also found a great contemporary Italian restaurant called Ask (think it's a chain) right around the corner and actually dined there several times!! When Trip Advisor asks if I would recommend this hotel to a friend, it would really depend on what they are looking for. It's probably a bit rough for some so I said no. Still think it would be hard to beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, convenient location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Fishysharon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in May 2010 for a week. Rather small room w little bathroom but rather comfy. Breakfast is really basic but alright. Loved the location as buses and Paddington station was less than 5 mins walk. Internet available at lobby, got to get reception to activate. There's a cheap internet cafe w much faster connection nearby... so no worries for me. Friendly staff, they allowed me to leave my lugguge when my check-in time was too early and when my check-out time was up...

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Elandem
Reviews.Content: We found the quality of the reception, room and breakfast at the Westpoint Hotel to be the worst of all of the places we stayed at during our two-month tour of 14 countries in Europe and the UK. We were especially unhappy with the attitude of the duty manager on check-in. Having been allocated a claustrophobic room in the basement, we attempted to negotiate an upgrade. Regrettably we were met with an almost arrogant response, suggesting that if we didnâ€™t like what we were given we could try booking in somewhere else. We will be certainly taking this advice on board when next we visit London!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: 852kane
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near paddington station but away from the noise,rooms are small and basic but very clean and tidy. Staff are very friendly and willing to help. Read some of the last reviews before we stayed, remember this is a small budget hotel not the hilton as the the cost is only a tenth. If your room gets warm open the window.

Reviews.Title: “I bet Mandela's prison cell was bigger than our room”
Reviews.Author: Giakoumis
Reviews.Content: Extra small rooms and very hot. No remote for the TV. We specifically asked for three single beds at the time of booking but we ended up with a double and a single. When we complained we were told by the smiling staff that there was nothing they could do. Actually that was their respond to almost everything (but always smiling). Keep in mind that if you ask them to keep your luggage in the storage room for a few hours your luggage will be completely unprotected. Their policy on this subject is to give the key to the room to anyone who asks for it. That means that many people have access to your luggage and anyone can easily steal them. Of course they have a sign that states that the hotel has no responsibility if anything gets lost. The location is great but the area is full of hotels so if I had to visit London again I would look for another hotel in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “ROOM FAR TOO HOT”
Reviews.Author: carmarthenangel
Reviews.Content: What a lovely clean well decorated hotel with lovely staff, we only used this hotel as a base as we had a wedding in london, really impressed until we tried to go to bed it was unbearingly hot we opened the window which opened about a foot{ thats probably for health and safety reasons} we had a little fan which we left on all night and had about 4 hours sleep, we were on ground level so be warned when booking very hot room!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but be realistic!”
Reviews.Author: bdtr4
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three night, not really to much to complain about, but our expectations were not sky high considering what we paid, Location is great very close to Paddington and Lancaster Gate tube and a short stroll from Hyde Park, plenty of restaurants ad bars very close by (nearest pub 20m!). Our room was TINY, on the ground floor near the kitchens so got very hot (no aircon) this was really the only bad point for us.Hotel looked really nice from the outside and reception area but room dont live up to this.If you can cope with tiny rooms I would recommend for cost and location.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not what is advertised on the net”
Reviews.Author: margo57Australia
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are so small and dingy,the tv'sdo not have any remotes, you can probably geta better room if you are prepared to pay extra for a larger room, this would have to be the worwst place we stayed in while we were travelling around UK, we paid for more for this room than any other place we stayed in while travelling , if you stayed more than one day you need to ask them to clean your room early otherwisethey are still cleaning it at 3.00 pm in the afternoon, and they only give you two satchets of coffee and 4sachets of sugar, they feel this is enough and when you ask for more they give you two more satchets, on the whole a very disappointing stay, the only thing going for it it is close to the train stations.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, EASY TO FIND, NO BACON AT BREAKFAST!!”
Reviews.Author: chubbyv
Reviews.Content: Very impressive foyer, but then when you go into the little hallways and stairs the carpets are threadbare in places! The room was small but ample, we had a triple with a double and a single. The bathroom was small but clean and well decorated, maybe not for "THE LARGER PERSON" The dining room was clean and impressive only to be let down by the quality of the food! The cooked breakfast was scrambled egg with beans and cheap sausages (NO BACON!) there were also cold meats and cheese. and toast and jam. Maybe this is what people want as many of the other guests were from all over the world . THIS HOTEL IS VERY EASY TO FIND, 2MINS WALK FROM PADDINGTON STATION AND BUSES,YOU CAN BE IN THE CENTRE OF THE TOURIST AREAS IN ABOUT AN HOURS STEADY STROLL THROUGH HYDE PARK TO BUCKINGHAM PALACE THEN DOWN THE MALL TO BIG BEN! OR JUMP ON THE TUBE AND ITS 15/20 MINS. APART FROM THE BREAKFAST THIS HOTEL DID THE JOB! CHEAP AND CLEAN.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, value and adequate”
Reviews.Author: rummytheowl
Reviews.Content: Needed a low cost hotel for one night and the Westpoint was chosen off the web on price and location. As for the latter, it's 5 mins walk from Paddington station and round the corner from shops, restaurants etc. Friendly and efficient service from the staff at check in and at breakfast. They all seemed attentive and helpful. Hotel itself is a warren of corridors and clearly not at the level of Â£100plus per night ones. The bedroom was small, but clean. My gripe was with the tv, set high on a bracket with no remote! Breakfast ok too and if you go there and don't want to spend too long in your room lounging about it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: turepalsson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice, and I have found it to be your typical London budget hotel, with labyrinthine corridors, creaking staircases (not to mention the lift!), carpeting with which you should probably not get too intimate, tiny rooms and bathrooms of the kind where you have to plan ahead before going in, because you may not be able to turn around once you have shut the door. All clean, working and perfectly adequate, though, if nowhere near luxurious. Breakfast a bit uninspiring but, again, perfectly adequate. Excellent location a few hundred metres from Paddington (Tube, Heathrow Express) and Lancaster Gate (tube). Several restaurants and pubs of varying quality within a 100m radius. You will find plenty of reviewers saying that there are much better hotels at the same price. I have stayed in a number of similar London hotels, and in my experience this is actually one of the better ones. I will consider it for my next London trip, and I would not hesitate to recommend it to friends, as long as they read the previous paragraph before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Really not great”
Reviews.Author: Djynja
Reviews.Content: It was a bit shabby and old. Breakfast was ok but pretty basic. The mattress on the bed was smaller than the bed base so it was really cramped to sleep. Really mean with the tea and coffee. For what we paid there must be plenty of nicer hotels. The only thing that saved it is it's so close to Paddington station.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Alinealt
Reviews.Content: Even dough the hotel is clean, well located and has a nice staff, it's not worth the price. In our room, there was a tiny table with a tiny kit for making tea and only one tiny chair. There were also two comfortable single beds (probably the only two things that weren't tiny in that bedroom), a tiny mirror and an even tinier wardrobe. It would have been ok for only one person, but too small for being a double room. Ah, and there was no towel dryer in the toilet (which, btw, was also tiny) and the shower was terrible. They also had no minibar in the bedroom. The breakfast was average, with few options to choose from. I would only recommend this hotel as a last minute choice, otherwise you can find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Loula
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the grand entrance - my experience seems that they spent all the money on the statues in there. The rooms were tiny, wardrobe space absolutely minimal and the double bed was not a full double. The room we stayed in was absolutely tatty, the door didn't shut properly and was too small for the doorway so there was a large uneven gap underneath it. Even more worryingly the staff seemed to think it was ok to walk into the rooms without knocking which left us a little bit dubious as to our safety. The bathroom was tiny and the shower didn't look as though it had been cleaned properly in quite some time. The staff were rude and unhelpful, I called to ask for some milk (which was missing from the tea and coffee making facilities) and was asked to go down to reception (we were on the top floor) to collect it myself. The location of the hotel was very handy for Paddington station but to be honest I'd rather stay a bit further away and have a safe and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DISASTER -FOUND A MOUSE IN THE ROOM”
Reviews.Author: ROULA-THANOS
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room in the hotel for 6 days around the end of December 09. During our 1st night at the hotel we were weak up by strange noise in the Room When we turn on the light we came across a shock as next to my head was standing a MOUSE!!!! After the shock we went down to reception to report the case. The receptionist 1st reply was: I'm not coming up to check for the mouse and it seems that there is no other room available:. After a long discussion!!!! he found a room!! We had to un-pack and then pack again all of our staff in the midle of t the night!! and then move to another room. In the morning we were looking for the Manager to discuss our problem but although we made 4 attempts we were told that the Manager is not yet in ( from 8am -10am). Finally the assistant Manager who was present there at all times and was aware of the case, she decide to talk to us. Instead of atleast apologize she became ironic by making funny comments and making jokes of the situations although it was a serious case. At the end she became more ironic and roud and one member of staff start to talking in a nasty way and saying to my wife [--] COW!! Even worst he took a big wooden stick and threaten to HIT us!!! We had to call the police to assist us as we were threaten. They never apologize to the contrary they told us to give our money back with the condition to vacate immediately our room and leave the hotel. We found our selfs in very unpleasent situation as it was 28th of DEC and we had to find a room for the next 5 days!! As it was the new year holidays everythinh was fully booked. Thnaks god, we were lucky to find a room in the nearby Orchard hotel which was by far better. Ending NEVER EVER AGAIN TO THIS HOTLE AS EVEN A HOSTEL IS MUCH BETTER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice foyer but....”
Reviews.Author: Eddiefatpaws
Reviews.Content: This hotel has spent a lot of money on the foyer but the rooms are dated and run down. It was clean, quiet and adequate for 1 night but little things really let it down; radiator stuck on, TV broken, fixed shower head and no shower caps. I would only reccommend this place for a brief flying visit but DO NOT have breakfast. It was totally awful and the restaurant is dominated by a vast filthy fish tank full of bored lloking koi. It was like trying to eat at the bottom of a pond. There are lovely little cafes just round the corner - a much safer bet.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but fooled by picture of reception on internet”
Reviews.Author: irish32Cbar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well located but I found it very fooling to the eye. The reception looks like a 3 star hotel alright but as soon as you get to the room you really get a shock. It is really small you can hardly move. The bathroom is like a small closet, shower ok, but you literally have nowhere to leave your toiletries and you can bang your knee very easily off the sink when you get out of the shower if you are anyways tall. I think it is over priced for what it is, you just have a luxurious lobby area which is of no benefit to anyone as there is no bar there at all. I went down for the breakfast one morning and the sausages was shriveled up and not too appetising. Besides that all i saw was baked beans and scrambled eggs. They also had cereal but I'm not a cereal type person. I just had some toast and juice because that's all that I thought would be edible enough to eat. The staff were very nice but I just thought it's an over rated hotel and the price is just too much for a box room. It's an okay hotel if you are just staying one or two nights, pretty central to everything but I don't think it's great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: beedee007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. The location of the hotel if great, tube station literally 2 min walk from the hotel, numerous cafes, bars, restaurants and shops within a 2-4 minute walk. Good location for Hyde Park. The hotel itself really did leave a lot to be desired. I didn't pay 5 star price, so didn't expect 5 star facilites/experience, but expected better than I got. Reception area was really nice, but the room was shabby and if you're taller than a 7 year old, the sink in the bathroom is a big NO. Although the bedding was clean, the room definitely needed sprucing up! It was also very noisy, and that wasn't from the traffice outside, it was from the noise inside e.g. housekeeping, lift, walls were very thin. Not the best bed I've slept in! Also, the shower tray in the room didn't drain away so you had to keep switching the shower off. We did complain when we checked out, reception offered an apology and said they would have moved us into a different room if we had stayed longer. All I can say is give me a travel inn or premier in anyday.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't judge a book by its cover"”
Reviews.Author: LeoIreland
Reviews.Content: If you look on the hotel's own website, you will see that the public rooms are beautiful. However, the bedrooms leave a lot to be desired. We first became alarmed when the lift door opened and the opposite wall was about two foot away. Our room was small, and whilst the bedding and surfaces were clean, the carpet was not. The attached photos will show exactly how shabby the room was, and as for the bathroom - we have cupboards at home which are bigger. Open the door and immediately in front of you is a tiny sink, completely inadequate for doing anything more that rinsing one's hands. To the left was a shower tray and to the right, a toilet. From front to back it measured no more than two feet (60cms). We were told at reception that all the rooms were the same. The only thing going for it is it's location and a pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ludalua
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just one block from Paddington and few minutes walk to Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park. You cannot get better location than that especially if arriving by train at Paddington. Our room was small as it is usual the case for most of the hotels along Sussex Gardens but suited us nicely. The toilet/shower room was also small but everything was very clean. The beds were adequate but the pillows a bit on the hard side. Breakfast was exactly the same for the three days we stayed at the hotel and you get tired of it after day 2. It is buffet style and they provide two types of cereal, tin fruit salad, some dry fruit, apple and orange juice, cheese and ham, scrambled eggs, sausage and baked beans, toast (white and brown), butter and one type of jam. They could at least try to vary the breakfast options in consecutive days ( I guess it doesn't take much to change the sausage for bacon every other day or add a different type of bread. Staff in reception were friendly and efficient. The hotel has one computer that guests can use free of charge (don't know if they have wireless). Compared to other hotels nearby, this was adequate and good value. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pweek
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting luxury at the Westpoint's relatively low rates in an expensive city, but we were pleased with the Westpoint. The location, a block from Paddington Train Station and Underground and near Hyde Park, is its biggest plus. Rooms are tiny - no room for large suitcases! - but spotlessly clean and are adequate for travellers who don't plan to spend much time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Close to the Tube.”
Reviews.Author: yellowvwbeetle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for nine nights on first arriving in England and with it being so close to Paddington Station and a number of different small cafes and restaurants it was excellently positioned and well priced for one person. The room was small and the bathroom tiny but given that all I was doing there was sleeping it wasn't a problem. It may have been a bit more squishy with two people, but for one it was fine. The included breakfast was decent and good enough to get me going every morning. The staff were all friendly and everything was always keep neat and clean. The only thing that was perhaps slightly annoying was that you had to hand in you key before leaving the hotel, obviously so you don't loose it, not a big hassle but it did require a detour to the front desk before leaving or on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Outside & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: VietnamClaire
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night as a base for a get together with my mum and sister. We wanted somewhere close to Paddington allowing us to hop on the tube and get to St Pancreas stn relatively easily so from that respect it was perfect. Upon arrival the hotel looks very grand and the lobby is impressive too...unfortunately thats where it ends! We had a triple room on the fourth floor which was very dated, the windows weren't very secure and the bathroom was tiny...thankfully we are all fairly petite. For one night as a base we really couldn't grumble as the beds were comfy and linen clean. The stay did include breakfast which thankfully we didn't expect anything impressive given the price..we popped our heads in the door looked at the soggy toast, had a quick sip of sweet apple juice and heeaded for Starbucks! I can also note the parking is very cheap only Â£10 for 24/hrs

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!! Awful!”
Reviews.Author: RomyA
Reviews.Content: In August 2009 we visited this hotel for the second time. This was a complete disaster in contrast to the first visit (October 2007). They gave us a very small room next to the breakfast room. There was no airconditioning and it was incredibly hot in the room. At 7.30 in the morning we woke up due to the noise from the housekeepers and the doors from the breakfast room that were constantly slammed open and closed. Due to the heat in the room we opened te window, however the housekeeper just closed the window from te outside again! Next, the housekeeper tried to open our room even though you would think they know there are people in the room! After trying to come in with the key, she realised there were people in the room. Since we were wide awake by then, (8 o'clock in the morning) and the heat was unbearable, we showered (in the very tiny bathroom) just to get away from this terrible hotel as soon as possible. While checking out we complained at the front desk. However, the staff did not care at all. After doubting for a long time they told us they could not do anything. They did not understand what our problem was and no matter what had happened, we wouldn't get a refund or discount or whatsoever anyway. The only thing we could do was fill in a complaints form. After asking how this would help us they funnily said: nothing! We told them this was our second time visiting their hotel (they don't care about that either) and that we would never come back again. Another thing they didn't care about at all. Apparently they believe there are enough other customers anyway.The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is its location. Not even 5 minutes walking from Paddington Station (Bakerloo & District/Circle line). Luckily enough there are many many other alternatives in the same region!! Do not visit this awful awful hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive lobby but basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Karen079
Reviews.Content: As you walk into the hotel your opinion will be that it's highly rich but seeing the room upstairs would give you a bit of disappointment. Rooms are a bit larger than the size of the bed, wardrobe is incorporated inside the wall and the bathroom is a pigeon hole. The beds are comfortable though and well equipped with quilt and fresh sheets. Cleanliness is great but the bathroom is limited. We only had a basic very small hotel soap to use, the shower is stuck to the wall and can' t be handheld and there is no place to move. The whole bathroom is literally not more than 5 tiles square. We had two rooms and they were both the same. Apart from all this, the breakfast is good though the same everyday. It consists of scrambled eggs, cold cuts, cheese, baked beans and sausages. There is also toasted bread with jam and butter available. Internet is free downstairs but you have to get the receptionist' s permission first. The location of this hotel is excellent though. It is very near the Paddington Tube and train station, in fact we travelled both ways by the heathrow connect to the airport and back. This is the best advantage of this hotel. There are also plenty of restaurants where to eat in the area. Basically the hotel is not luxurious but if you only need a good located hotel it is the one for you because the location is really great.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: jamesthurlow
Reviews.Content: Despite being in a great location, this has to be one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in (including ones in remote Zambia and Ethiopia). The rooms are absolutely tiny, the bathrooms even smaller, and the staff is completely indifferent to their guests. If you are there in summer then the rooms double as saunas! The hotel breakfast is appaling - if you are lucky enough to get scrabbled eggs then you can expect it to come with shells as well! What makes this hotel particularly bad is that there are plenty of alternative hotels to choose from right next door. Based on casual observation, I would say that the Stylotel and Hotel Indigo are far superior alternatives despite being the same price. So avoid West Point at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Just a convenient place to stay for the night”
Reviews.Author: aukahkay
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I am staying at Westpoint Hotel, the last time being in 2001. On my recent trip in June 2009, I noticed a decline in the standard of this hotel. First, let me talk about the good points of the hotel - its location. It is only 5 minutes walk to Paddington Station and is therefore very convenient for the Heathrow Express and tube. I had a single room - room 16. It is located between levels 1 and 2 on the mezzanine level. To access it, I had to climb up a flight of stairs and open a fire door before I could get to the door of the room. The fire door opens inwards towards the room door. This made it a bit clumsy getting my luggage into the room as I had to hold the fire door open with my luggage while opening the room door. There was no hair dryer in the room and no TV remote control. Disposable plastic cups were used in the bathroom sink. Only two small cakes of soap were provided - no hair shampoo. As with other traditional hotels in the Paddington area, there was no air-conditioning. Breakfast was in the basement - buffet style. Because it was summer, the hotel was quite full and if you went for breakfast at 8.30 am, you had to wait outside for another guest to vacate the table. At GBP 72 for a single room, it is not really worth the price. You can get a similar hotel in Sussex Gardens area for GBP 50. As I said, the only advantage is its location.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been better; it could have been worse.”
Reviews.Author: kellili
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location; it's about one block from Paddington station, within walking distance of Hyde Park. The room was adequate, although I would have liked more tea and more milk. The front desk staff was friendly and tried to be helpful, although they often didn't know basic information. Best: location. Least: The breakfast was AWFUL. Next time, I'll just buy breakfast somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “OK, if all you want is a clean place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: berengei
Reviews.Content: The Westpoint / Abbeycourt hotel is a real mixed blessing. The best selling point is its location, a block from Paddington Station, down a street of inexpensive, decent restaurants and an excellent, genuine pub (not a tourist trap). It can't be beat for convenience. However... The place reminded me of the old hotels and bedsits where I used to stay in the Bayswater neighborhood of London in the early-mid eighties. Except for the rather tacky (but new) lobby, the decor is definitely Thatcher-era. Worn, but clean. The elevator is one of the slowest I've ever experienced. We stayed in two different rooms. The first was incredibly cramped; I have friends who would have had trouble entering the room or using the bathroom. There wasn't enough room to open a suitcase, except for on the bed-- and these were carry-on sized cases, not full-sized. The second room was slightly less cramped, but on the top floor, and very, very stuffy. Both bathrooms were tight and in so-so condition, with a tiny cracked porcelain shelf over the toilet (!) that was just big enough to put your toothbrush on to dry overnight. Breakfast was as other reviewers have described it-- nothing to write home about-- though I liked the giant koi tank. No one told us that a TV remote could be had for a 10 pound deposit, so we did without, which was a bit of a nuisance. The wi-fi was crap, so overtaxed as to be nearly at a standstill, and really only usable in the lobby anyway. And the fact the the phones are rigged so that you can only make a local call with a phone card (never mind a long distance one) seems petty and mean. All that said, the staff-- with one exception, which I'll get to in a minute-- were sweet, friendly and helpful, and in no way would I blame them for the hotel's failings. Without them, the place would be a hellhole. As it is, it's a serviceable and conveniently located place to crash after a day of sightseeing or a night of partying. But that's all. This formula becomes a problem only when something goes wrong-- which for us, did. My mother lost her bank card at 11pm on a Saturday night, and we discovered that not only was it impossible to reach an operator from the hotel "phones," even with a five pound phone card, but the guy who was staffing the front desk either did not speak English or was incredibly stupid. Either way, he gave me a number that turned out to be the emergency ambulance hotline. When I went downstairs to tell him this he looked perplexed, then just shrugged. We ended up having to get dressed again and walk over to Paddington Station at 1 am and use a public phone to place a collect call to Citibank. The next morning I asked the girl at the desk for a white pages so I could find the number of the nearest American Express office, since of course there were no phone books in the rooms. She didn't have one either. Thankfully I'd lugged my computer along and found the office by going online (which took 30 minutes with the hotel's crappy connection.) So-- if you need a reasonably price place to crash, and nothing else, you might consider the Westpoint/Abbeycourt. (I do wonder if the addition of "Abbeycourt" is an attempt to dodge all these negative reviews.) But if you want or need ANYTHING in the way of services or amenities, you should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good clean accomodation”
Reviews.Author: LorrieWA
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews about this hotel I was a little concerned about staying here. We stayed for 3 days and I have no complaints. The staff were friendly and very efficient. (Even suggesting that we sort our bill the night before leaving to avoid the morning queue.) The rooms were clean and breakfast more than adequate for the price that you pay. The location is fantastic. Being close to Paddington station was great. Made sightseeing using the underground easy. Great value for money considering that your in London.

Reviews.Title: “basement room”
Reviews.Author: dominica1
Reviews.Content: i have been here 3 days ago wit my two friend and we booked triple room. We came to the hotel at about 4. a.m morning. Building and lobby are very nice, night receptionist was very nice and gave to us our key. Our room was on downstairs with view to laundry and front of the window was wall. One day was there a man who made horrible sound under our window. Our window was possible open only 30cm up! This room was very small and furniture was so old. This room wasnt from 3stairs hotel!!!Our shower was so small and shower flood was very low. When we wanted made a shower it stayes very long so we called to reception and we wanted change a room but recetionist said we must wait till the morning. Ok. In th emorning we came to the reception and other receptionist said it is problem and its possible stay our luggage in luggage room and they try to solve this problem. But we need a shower and she gave us other room and said we can to use this shower.It was horrible, because this shower wass worse like first. So at about 20 minutes came technic man and repair the shower. It was horrible night/morning. Breakfast was very poor. But this hotel has a very good location near the paddington and HYde PArk. Thats all

Reviews.Title: “Best part of the Hotel was the foyer”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBruno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have travelled a bit over the past few years, and this Hotel would be the worst place we've ever stayed at. The room was so small we had nowhere to place our luggage except on the floor next to the bed in front of the bathroom door. This was a major hazard during the night. Carpet was thread-bare, the bathroom so small I had to leave the door open to shower and sit on the loo!! The lift was out of action regularly and you had to walk down steep stairs to the dining room for breakfast. Speaking of breakfast - it was disgusting - self serve cold scrambled eggs floating in water plus a selection of cold processed meats. We found this place in a London Guide book - looked great on paper but was anything but. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrible place”
Reviews.Author: karmapoliceUk
Reviews.Content: First of all, you have to pay a 10 pound deposit if you want a remote control for the TV..... What is that all about? A nice little racket going on there I bet, when lots of guests forget to return their remote to the reception. Secondly, after about 8am the hotel had no hot water..... Just what you need a cold shower at 8:30 every morning. It may be cheap, but it's not that cheap - cost is no excuse for dreadful customer service. Yet another London hotel to score off my ever-growing list of places to avoid like the plague....

Reviews.Title: “Lousy”
Reviews.Author: PhilJHB
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel in 2001, and have done so everytime that I have been back to London. However, the attitude of the hotel has changed dramatically over this time, and I will NEVER stay there again. Maria the manageress, or so she calls herself is arrogant and does the freindly British image no favours. I will attempt to find out who the MD of this hotel group is and I will express in no uncertain terms my disappointment of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westpoint Hotel Small Rooms, Small Price”
Reviews.Author: MVCA0Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very low cost, we paid only 89 pounds for two people. You get what you pay for. The room was extremely small. My husband called the shower (no tub) "the phone booth". Absolutely no space to lay out your toiletries in the bathroom. The bars of soap were super small. The shower has a wire rack for the soap tray. The soap kept falling through the tray. Our suitcases could only be opened on the bed. We did get a double bed and a twin, which was nice. They use every inch of room in the hotel, which makes the room placement interesting. Our room was on the first floor, but actually it was on floor 1/2. You could climb stairs at the end of the lobby and reach it (after opening a couple of doors) or take the elevator to the first floor go down to the end of the hall and go around a corner and down several stairs to reach it. It was difficult to deal with our large luggage since there was no way to reach the room without stairs in some direction. The room overlooked the back of the hotel and a very old roof. Breakfast was included in the price, which was a plus. But the breakfast is the same each day: a basket of toast/butter/jam, a slice of ham and cheese, cornflakes or rice crispies, coffee, apple juice or fruit punch. Boring after 5 days. Location is a couple block from Padding, easy to find. Hotel is actual 3 different hotels, everyone eats together. They had 2 very old PCs near the lobby for internet access. Not enough for everyone, so you had to wait in line. Only available 8:30 am to 10 pm. Really good if you are on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: antrivexxi
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation on the hotel's website, because they provided a much better rate. I must confess that I was a little concerned due to the many mixed reviews I read on different websites. I stayed at the Westpoint for six nights. The hotel could not have had a better location. It was only two minutes from Paddington Train and Tube stations and in a safe and nice area. I was lucky to get a room that did not face the two major streets (London St. and Sussex Gardens). Even though my room was indeed small, it was also very clean. The twin bed was very comfortable and linens were clean. The bathroom was small, but recently remodeled. It had a new shower, toilet, and sink. Walls and ceiling had tiles. The room was cleaned, garbage taken out, and towels changed every single day. I also had a TV, not with many channels, but I did not go to London to watch TV or sleep. The breakfast was simple (cereals, toasts, ham, and cheese), but acceptable. It could improve by adding some yogurts and fruits, but I guess it will increase the rate. It was not a big deal for me. The entire staff was courteous, polite, helpful, and friendly. And that includes reception, the breakfast room, and housekeeping. The best feature of the hotel is: location, location, location!!!!! I will stay at the Westpoint again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The Pits”
Reviews.Author: sar_09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this 'hotel' for two nights with my partner and will never return to this hotel even if i was paid to stay there. I travel all over the world with my job and have stayed in mostly 3 star hotels but this hotel is by far the worst. The room was very small and dated that no amount of cleaning would make it welcoming, the toilet was very small and the toilet door when closed was very difficult to open and when flushed the toilet kept running, the shower base was sealed with duck tape and the water had no pressure even though we were on the first floor! The tv had no remote control. The continental breakfast consisted of cornflakes, apple juice, cold toast and tea or coffee. The cooked breakfast was just as bad and tasteless. The Hotel staff were less than helpfull and even though we handed our key into reception before 9am when we returned to the hotel at 1530hrs to get ready for our evening event our room was not madeup. BE WARNED AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS!

Reviews.Title: “Some good.... Some bad....”
Reviews.Author: Franceisfine
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit. We (4 adults) stayed 3 nights Aug./05 and 6 nights April/08. Hotel hasn't changed at all. I'll start with "the good." Price. Location is fantastic. We used Heathrow Express which is a 5 minute walk from Paddington Station. We also travelled to Oxford and Windsor from Paddington. You can buy "cheap day return" tickets right at station. Numerous trains throughout the day. Don't bother booking head. Hotel is close to St. Pancras and Kings Cross for other trains out of London. There are a couple of tube lines that run through Paddington and most London attractions are a short ride and some are walkable. Lots of restaurants, pubs and shops nearby. Area around the hotel is clean and safe. Check-in and out was efficient, front desk staff helpful. Reception area very nice. Free internet which was usually available. Fairly quiet at night. Rooms, beds and bathrooms were clean. (other than the awful mildew smell of the shower curtain). Beds were old but okay. Now for "the bad." Maybe 6 nights was a few too many. I don't remember our rooms being so tiny our first visit. We booked 2 twins. One of the rooms looked into a dirty lane/back of hotel. It was very stuffy even with the window open and the outside temp. was only 10 degrees. Ventilation was poor. This room smelled of food cooking (oil and spices) the entire time. The other room was fine since it faced the side of the hotel which is a quiet tree-lined street. One of the rooms had no space for luggage. Hotel uses duvets now which are way too warm. Rugs, wallpaper and paint all need replacement. Phones in room only work with a calling card - even for local calls. Pay phone downstairs is 20p for a minute (local call). Breakfast needs to be mixed up a bit. It was the exact same 3 years ago and its the same every morning. Cornflakes, instant coffee, toast, juice. Every table gets a few slices of really bad ham and okay cheese. Its the same every morning. Breakfast service is efficient and friendly. No complaints there. Cancellation policy is 7 days. People continue to smoke in rooms. We smelled cigarette smoke regularly in the halls. The smell woke me up at 4:00 a.m. so I called the front desk. They try (but not to hard) to "track" it down. I looked out my window and saw a woman smoking in the room adjacent, holding the cigarette out the window. The smoke was wafting into our room. She quickly "butted out" when I told her to "put that cigarette out please!" Management should be more diligent and not leave it up to guests to police this problem. A quick walk throughout the hallways on a regular basis is all they need to do. I would stay in this hotel again, (for a few nights) and request a room that does not face the lane. The location and price cannot be beat. P.S. If you want good (cheap) Thai food and a large variety of beer, try The Churchill Arms on Kensington Church Street. The pub is very popular and there's a Thai restaurant at the back. Rick Steves London book recommended it and we're glad we went.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it....”
Reviews.Author: Regular_Bloke
Reviews.Content: Three stars??? I really can't see how it got any at all, never mind three. Even describing this establishment as a hotel is stretching the English language beyond its limit and certainly does no justice to all those REAL hotels out there. Stayed here over three nights last month - myself, my wife and our three children (two of them teenagers). I waited a couple of weeks before writing this review because I needed that time to cool down a bit before writing. We booked this place directly with the hotel because it was unclear whether they would accommodate 5 people in a family room. We were assured verbally on the phone that 5 people would not be a problem. Well it wasn't a problem until we got there and tried to check in - we almost had to beg to get them to put an extra bed in the room. Ahhh... the room!!! What a horrible smelly hole in the ground of a room it was. Even without the extra bed in there, you could hardly walk around the beds, though in hindsight, perhaps this was a blessing insofar as it minimized contact with the dirty, dreary carpet on the floor. We were only staying three days so we didn't have too much luggage with us but we still had to "live out of our suitcases" - there was not enough space/storage to facilitate complete unpacking of our one suitcase and a few small bags! This was a disappointing start to our city break. Never mind - we'll go out, get something to eat, walk the streets of London and we won't have to be back here 'til late. Well, we got back later that night and decided to go to the bar to get some quick snacks and drinks. Now, where could they possibly have put it? Aw no, No bar, No restaurant, No Snacks - Nothing! Back to our little hole in the ground - we squinted as we tried to watch a tiny 14-inch TV with only about 5 TV Stations to choose from. The beds were reasonably comfortable and the sheets were clean, but the blankets didn't smell too fresh. We were woken bright and early next morning by the staff starting their work shift just before 0700. They made quite a loud racket pushing containers and vacuum cleaners around and chatting and laughing so loudly. This turned out to be a daily ritual, and each day it continued for well over an hour. Did I mention the en suite bathroom? Indeed, we had a toilet and shower en-suite, but if you didn't enter the en suite at the correct angle, turning around or manoevering after you were in there was really quite difficult (and I'm not a large person at a mere 176cm/74kg). Oh yes, the shower... the wimpy little dribbly trickle of water that emanated from the shower-head was really quite pathetic - but apart from the discomfort factor of limited water and space, all of us taking a shower took probably three or four times longer than it should have, thereby wasting our valuable sightseeing time. There wasn't even room in there for a shelf over the wash-hand basin on which to keep toothbrushes, razor, etc - they were safely packed back into our bags after each use!! It's breakfast time - We made our way to the breakfast room. One of the walls had a floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall fish tank - this was really gross - the fish were large and ugly; fighting among themselves over bits of gunk in the water, and the tank's murky water looked like it could have come from the Thames itself!. Anyway, we're all very hungry and continental breakfast is complimentary. Well, when I saw it I knew why! The coffee was not freshly brewed - more like a cheap instant coffee from the 70's; the toast was cold and limp and rubbery - so rubbery in fact that I could not bite through it without gnashing. Some bits of "meat" and cheese on a plate were also provided but these too proved to be completely inedible to us. Looking through to the kitchens, I could see a team of people washing dishes in the large sink and drying them - manually!! They didn't even have a dishwasher. By the way, there's a Garfunkels just down the road - they do proper, tasty food and service with a smile. Incidentally, this so-called hotel has no pool, no leisure facilities, no lounge, no security on the baggage room (they lend you the key and you have unmonitored, unaccompanied access to everyone's bags!) no air-conditioning, no shampoo or shower gel in the bathroom (they did provide toilet paper though), no porter to assist with bags, the slowest elevator in the world (I used the stairs with my bags after waiting for 5 minutes), and absolutely nothing to recommend it. I will not darken their door with my presence ever again - not if I was paid to. Frankly, a park bench in nearby Hyde Park is more appealing. If visiting London means you have to stay here; just stay at home - it's simply not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheTank08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westpoint for two nights , one before our trip to Paris & one after . Great location to the tube & walking distance to Oxford St & Hyde Park . We have two children & we were all able to stay in one room along with two big suitcases & backpacks. Room & Bathroom were clean & staff very friendly & helpful. Continental breakfast was included & very nice , cereal , toast ( you can get extra if you want ) ham & cheese etc... One good point was the baggage holding facility , they give you a key to put any suitcases etc..in the locked room for as long as you want , this comess in handy if you checkout & want to see some London sights before departing the city Overall , very good value for Money ...

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NOT STAY AGAIN EVEN IF IT WAS FOR FREE”
Reviews.Author: JENNISHE
Reviews.Content: Stayed there just after Xmas with my husband and daughter in a triple room. The room was so small we could not unpack as there was no where to put the suitcases never mind our clothes! The bathroom was miniscule and the entire room was dingy. Paint was peeling off of the walls, the furniture looked like someone had found it in a tip and the room was surrounded by mirrors which gave the whole room a grotty bedsit feel!! The temperature in the room was so cold my husband was ill for a week after leaving! We were given the key for another room - but hey it worked anyway!! Secure or what!! The location is great but it is worth paying that bit extra and with so many hotels in the same area I would never stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at the Westpoint!!”
Reviews.Author: Karlkiwi
Reviews.Content: I just got home from my stay at the WestPoint and I swore that the first thing I'd do when I got back would be to write this warning for other people. So here it is. Where can I start... When I arrived at the WestPoint they sent me up to my room where I was shocked to see the size of the room. There was a double bed and nothing else. Barely enough room to walk around the outside of the bed, I'm not joking. It was nothing like it looked in pictures I had seen on their website. It was a truly cramped and horrible room. Having been in the room for about 30mins a staff member burst into our room without knocking apparently looking for something. He didnâ€™t find it, nor did he ask us if it was alright if we let him look around. 10mins later another staff member came in looking for something, I presume the same object but they never told us. Then 10mins later another one came in. They were completely rude, never knocked to come in and never apologised. Later that night I hoped in bed to watch some TV and drift off. The TV had no remote... In the morning we were awoken by someone looking to clean our room. Once again they didnâ€™t knock but the thing that really annoyed me about this was that it wasn't even checkout time yet!! I looked around the room for a "do not disturb" sign but there wasnâ€™t one... 30mins later and again without a knock someone barged into the room again... So I got up and went down to reception and made a complaint. I said that because I have had a cleaner steal something from my room in the past I didn't want my room to be cleaned. And that I was sick of staff coming into my room without knocking. I went out for the day and when I came back someone had cleaned my room. I had been totally ignoredâ€¦ The breakfast was extremely budget and ordinary.... I told reception that I urgently needed to use the internet in the morning. I went down in the morning but the internet was not working. They were very unhelpful in getting it fixed and I missed my deadline... All in all this was truly the worst stay I have ever had. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westpoint”
Reviews.Author: World_Gulliver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days and thought the hotel was outstanding. The staff were extremely helpful - more so than any of the other hotels that I stayed in during my trip. More than anything, this hotel offers tremendous value for money. It was far cheaper than anything else in its class and cheaper than most of the other hotels in Paddington; we got the book-early internet deal which was great. The breakfast was fine and kept us going well into the day. The bedrooms are not large, but we were told to expect that in Central London. It is extremely clean and the location is brilliant. It is close to Paddington station, which is where we took the train to from Heathrow and there are 2 tube stations nearby. Overall, this hotel far exceeded my expectations - and they were high!

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: highflyer07
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the hotel in July 2007. The only good thing I can say is that the location was excellent - very close to Paddington Station and a stop of the Big Bus Company. We stayed there for 3 nights and the bed sheets weren't changed at all, the windows didn't stay open and it was very hot. The breakfast was the worst continental I have ever had (1 slice of ham each, 1 slice of cheese, 1 cereal to choose from and toast). To make it worse, they pre-authorised the charge for both of us for the entire stay on one Visa without explaining that it acutally freezes the money.
